question: 扱う
sourceAnswer: to{} deal-with-(a-person)/treat/handle/take-care-of/entertain | deal-with-(a-problem)/handle/manage | operate-(e.g.-a-machine)/handle/work | deal-in/sell | cover-(a-topic)/treat/discuss/take-up | treat-A-as-B | mediate-(an-argument) | be-too-much-for-one/find-unmanageable | gossip
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>handle</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to handle</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the one you learned with the kanji, actually! Can you handle that?
